Posts.Content: That's the one Denzilpants ! That tops all others for me & your response is spot on ! I may have to put all these on Facebook & see how many people get the message ....
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: I already have. Mine was no. 5 !
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: Argh ! I hope you punched them for that Ali owl ?  No.17 . immigration officer at Gatwick checking my passport which shows me with long blond hair says very loudly for all to hear 'That's not you ! You've gone back to your natural look ! Me quietly : ' No I've had cancer' immigration officer : 'The curls suit you' . Me under my breath : 'know when to shut up ....please' What really got my goat is that normally immigration officers don't flinch let alone speak ! Why me ?  You  have to laugh
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: On a slightly different note when I went to tell my Mum & Step Dad about my diagnosis .........my step dad asked how I was & I said 'that's what I've come to talk to you both about' , my Mum jumped up & said ' oh no you're not pregnant are you ?' ( I was 55 & post menspausal at the time !) my response : ' I wish I was !' (Do I laugh or cry at my Mum's stupid remark, neither I was so gob smacked )
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: Jude58 & Nikonblue I'm sending big hugs to you both ! You should be able to get free counselling which may help you deal with your fears. I'm on anti depressants which keeps me on an even keel most of the time . As for the side effects that's what I find the hardest to deal with. I'm having Herceptin which ends in Jan & 5 years of hormone treatment. I challenge the effectiveness of the hormone tablets whenever I see my oncologist & Im still deciding whether the risk of not taking them out ways the improved quality of well being. ...make the most of your good days & give yourselves plenty of treats, you deserve it xx
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: OMG I'm so angry today ! Fed up with tender soles of my feet, fed up with aching bones , fed up with feeling like I'm 90 when I'm only 56 & especially fed up of looking in the mirror & seeing someone I dint recognise ! Does anyone else get days like this ?
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: 27. You're a strong woman ! .........umm, with a weak immune system
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: Well that's the thing Jediknight I finished chemo in Jan & radio in Feb ! Still  having Herceptin & Anastrozole . You get through the main treatment thinking you're going to start feeling better then the achy breaky bones start & the sore feet continue....I know I'm lucky in many ways but patience is not one of my virtues ! I haven't had many downers since being diagnosed 18 months ago so I will allow myself this one .... No . 5. Well at least your cured now .....I will strangle the next person who says this ! Thanks for all your comments , believe me I couldn't do this without you all . Much love xx
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: A brilliant post ! Thank you so much for that. I've finished all my treatment apart from Herceptin but since finishing radio have realised I'd kept all my emotions locked up for the past 8 months & they've now been unleashed ! Those positive words are very welcome xx
Posts.Title: I am a survivor!!

Posts.Content: Welcome Funda! Please don't worry about diet at this stage , I found as soon as I started chemo I got the munchies , mostly for fatty foods ! I was like th e honey monster of cooked breakfasts , I just couldn't get enough & every time I ate it it was the best cooked breakfast ever . It was quite like being pregnant & having cravings. It's only now, 10 months on from chemo that I'm really getting to grips with my diet. There are so many 'foods that cure cancer' . I try & listen to my body but have recently started introducing coconut water , coconut milk & coconut oil into my diet as they have so many benefits for hair, skin, bones & energy. Zinc is meant to be good for bones too & it's definitely the bones that seem to suffer mostly through all the treatment & beyond. focusing on one day at a time is definitely the best advice & be kind to yourself . lots of love xx
Posts.Title: New to this - saying hello and looking to connect

Posts.Content: Hi Genny I've been fortunate to get through all my treatment without suffering from constipation thanks to a friend who recommended organic linseed. Like flaxseed you can sprinkle it on porridge & crereals, salads , soups etc or take a teaspoon of it washed down with copious amounts of water. It worked a treat for me. I managed to keep the sickness at bay thanks to all the anti sickness tablets however suffered from terrible pains after chemo 4 & 5 & had to take very strong painkillers & like you didn't think I could take anymore but you can & will ! I booked a spa weekend with close friends for after my radio treatment so I had something to look forward to & celebrate. Good luck you're through the worse now. Lots of love x
Posts.Title: Endgame!!

Posts.Content: Hi Genny I've been fortunate to get through all my treatment without suffering from constipation thanks to a friend who recommended organic linseed. Like flaxseed you can sprinkle it on porridge & crereals, salads , soups etc or take a teaspoon of it washed down with copious amounts of water. It worked a treat for me. I managed to keep the sickness at bay thanks to all the anti sickness tablets however suffered from terrible pains after chemo 4 & 5 & had to take very strong painkillers & like you didn't think I could take anymore but you can & will ! I booked a spa weekend with close friends for after my radio treatment so I had something to look forward to & celebrate. Good luck you're through the worse now. Lots of love x
Posts.Title: Endgame!!

Posts.Content: i finished my chemo in January & my hair has grown back like a Brillo pad ! I've used specialist hair treatments but it still looks a mess. I've recently had it trimmed but feel I will have to bite the bullet  & have it cut into a pixie cut & hope it regrows in a more manageable manner. Has anyone had a similar experience? I'm getting married next Sept & want it to be long enough by then to use straighteners on It.
Posts.Title: Does anyone have curly chemo hair ?

Posts.Content: Well ladies at least now when I look in the mirror I'll remember your comments & have a good laugh instead of feeling miserable ! Thank you all so much for cheering me up xx
Posts.Title: Does anyone have curly chemo hair ?

Posts.Content: I did it ! Bit the bullet & had the curls chopped off ! Had to buy mini straighteners to maintain the look but it was worth it to ditch the wig ....
Posts.Title: Does anyone have curly chemo hair ?

Posts.Content: That's great to hear Windle ! How long did it take to get back to normal & did you have anything done to it in the meantime ?
Posts.Title: Does anyone have curly chemo hair ?

Posts.Content: Hi Tilly, I finished my chemo a year ago. Last Christmas I didn't recognise the fat , hairless creature I'd become but decided to put my face on Facebook to help my daughter raise money for Macmillan in the London Marathon. It shocked a lot of people But raised a staggering £1700 in 4 days ! She went on to raise over £5000 & has just been told by McMillan that she was in the top 1% of fund raisers last year.  A year later I have very thick very curly hair which I've had cut into a pixie cut & highlighted. After each hair appointment I look more like the old me but it's a slow process, much slower than I hoped to be honest.  BC treatment removes all vanity & lets you see your true beauty , your soul. Embrace the experience & hold the faith that you will feel & look like a sexual human being again in time . Love & hugs, Lorraine xx
Posts.Title: I'm not 'me'

Posts.Content: Wow you're all amazing ! Our bodies are amazing ! Our breast cancer journeys are so unique but there are always some common denominators. Thanks for sharing. It would be useful to put together a list of things that have helped us along our way both emotionally & physically but perhaps that's a question for another day. The funniest thing that happened was when I went to tell my Mum that I'd been diagnosed with breast cancer she thought I was going to tell her I was pregnant !! I'm 55 for Gods sake ! You have to laugh xx
Posts.Title: Are any of you having Herceptin injections?

Posts.Content: I've had 7 of 18 injections so far & starting to have problems with sensitive feet & aching joints . It would be useful to know if others are having similar symptoms.
Posts.Title: Are any of you having Herceptin injections?

Posts.Content: Hi Ellen how was your appointment today? If it was anything like mine (last July) you will have been bombarded with facts, statistics & options of treatment. Hope you're not feeling too confused or anxious x
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and need to read something positive

Posts.Content: Many thanks to you all its good to hear I'm not alone with this. I'm post menopausal so I don't go along with the menopause theory Jane. I'll see what my oncologist says about it on the 28th but it sounds to me like Herceptin is the culprit ! Like you AliG I'm struggling at night time with hip & leg pain & I feel like an 80 year old woman when I get out of bed in the morning! although I've been trying to keep off the tablets since chemo an Ibuprofen night cap sounds like a solution, anything to get a decent nights sleep. Thanks ladies xx ps Wish I'd found this site at the beginning of my journey. I'm not sure if the blogs are local or national, do any of you live near Exeter?
Posts.Title: Are any of you having Herceptin injections?
